intro: Zeuxine moniliformis, commonly known as the bearded bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Zeuxine moniliformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
